description: Installation of a driveway and crossover
decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the close proximity and position of the proposed crossover, has failed to demonstrate that the development will safeguard the protection and long term retention of the existing street tree. The proposal would, thus, result in harm to and potential loss of the tree to the detriment of the character and appearance of the street scene and the wider area contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12, DMHB 14 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two- Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposal by reason of the loss of the grass verge and front boundary wall and addition of hard landscaping of the front and side garden, which are attractive features on this part of Joel Street, would be detrimental to the visual amenity and character of the street scene, in which it would be set, by creating an open parking area, undefined boundary between the public and private domain and emphasising the appearance of a hard surfaced area. The proposals is thus, contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and the Council's 'Domestic Vehicle Footway Crossover' Policy-2022 and Policies DMT 1 and DMT2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposed front parking space would be of insufficient dimensions to accommodate a vehicle and by reason of inadequate manoeuvring details would likely result in undesirable turning movements over the pavement. This is contrary to Policy DMT 6 and Policy DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and Policies DMT 1 and DMT2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).
